required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Trial of Entecavir Versus Adefovir in the Treatment of Chronic Hepatitis B Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Open-Label, Comparative Study to Evaluate Early Viral Load Reductions and Exploratory Viral Kinetics Following Administration of Entecavir or Adefovir in Nucleoside-Naive Adults With Chronic Hepatitis B Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate antiviral activity and efficacy of entecavir (ETV) compared to adefovir in adults with chronic hepatitis B who have not been treated yet with an antiviral medicine.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Assay at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 12, adjusted for baseline (Week 12 - baseline). A negative value = improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HBV DNA by PCR Assay at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 48, adjusted for baseline (Week 48 - Baseline). A negative value = improvement.
Number of Subjects with HBV DNA <300 copies/mL by Roche COBAS® Amplicor (limit of quantitation 300 copies/mL)
Number of participants with ALT ≤ 1 x upper limit of normal (ULN)

secondary_outcome.measure: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics Estimates of Exponential Decay Model - Efficacy in Blocking Virus Production and de Novo Infections
secondary_outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. The model parameters of interest are the effectiveness of the drug in blocking virus production from infected cells (efficacy, ε) and effectiveness of the study treatment in blocking de novo infection of susceptible cells (η). The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics Estimates of Exponential Decay Model - Viral Clearance Rate and Infected Cell Death Rate
secondary_outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. The model parameters of interest are the clearance rate of the free virus (c), the death rate of productively infected cells (δ), The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics Estimates of Exponential Decay Model - Half-Life of Free Virus
secondary_outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. An important derived parameter is the half-life of free virus (ie, the average amount of time for HBV particles in plasma to be reduced to half the initial level), calculated as 24*ln(2)/c. The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics - Spline Model
secondary_outcome.description: This analysis uses a 3-parameter piece-wise linear model and describes the biphasic decline in HBV DNA (measured by PCR assay) through Week 12. The 3 parameters are the values for the 2 slopes, describing the first and second phase declines, respectively, and the estimated HBV DNA at the knot (at day 10; the time point where the 2 phases join). The biphasic viral decay kinetics for each treatment were obtained using a spline fitting procedure to estimate the 3 parameters for each subject; these estimates were then averaged within each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Safety - Most Frequent (> 10%) Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Deaths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cumulative through the end of on-treatment observation as available at the time of the Week 48 dataset
secondary_outcome.description: AE=new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship to treatment. SAE=untoward medical occurrence that is life-threatening, a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or an important medical event, or results in death, inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, or persistent/significant disability. AE grades: mild (1), moderate (2), severe (3), life-threatening (4), death (5). ALT flare= >2x baseline & >10x ULN up to end of therapy + 5 days. Hepatic SAE=SAEs consistent with worsening of hepatitis or hepatic decompensation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Safety - Laboratory Abnormalities Reported as Clinical AEs
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory abnormalities reported as clinical AEs

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, ETV 0.5 mg, once daily, up to 96 weeks
Tablets, Oral, ADV 10 mg, once daily, up to 96 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic hepatitis B treatment naive
- Compensated liver disease

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

reference.citation: Leung N, Peng CY, Hann HW, Sollano J, Lao-Tan J, Hsu CW, Lesmana L, Yuen MF, Jeffers L, Sherman M, Min A, Mencarini K, Diva U, Cross A, Wilber R, Lopez-Talavera J. Early hepatitis B virus DNA reduction in hepatitis B e antigen-positive patients with chronic hepatitis B: A randomized international study of entecavir versus adefovir. Hepatology. 2009 Jan;49(1):72-9. doi: 10.1002/hep.22658.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 132 enrolled; 63 not randomized (59 did not meet study criteria, 3 withdrew consent, 1 lost to follow-up). 1 randomized to adefovir (ADV) received entecavir (ETV) throughout treatment, & is counted in the ADV group for primary efficacy analysis, not included in the secondary efficacy analyses, & counted in the ETV group in safety analyses.

participants_list.participants: 1 participant randomized to ADV, treated with ETV. (As randomized= 35; as treated=36)
1 participant randomized to ADV, treated with ETV. (As randomized= 34; as treated=33)

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Hepatitis B virus DNA (HBV DNA) by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Assay at Week 12
outcome.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 12, adjusted for baseline (Week 12 - baseline). A negative value = improvement.
outcome.population: As-randomized participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Assay at Week 12
measure.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 12, adjusted for baseline (Week 12 - baseline). A negative value = improvement.
measure.population: As-randomized participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HBV DNA by PCR Assay at Week 48
outcome.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 48, adjusted for baseline (Week 48 - Baseline). A negative value = improvement.
outcome.population: Treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HBV DNA by PCR Assay at Week 48
measure.description: Antiviral efficacy, as measured by the mean reduction in serum HBV DNA levels by PCR (log10 copies/mL) at Week 48, adjusted for baseline (Week 48 - Baseline). A negative value = improvement.
measure.population: Treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

outcome.title: Viral Load Undetectable (HBV DNA <300 Copies/mL)
outcome.description: Number of Subjects with HBV DNA <300 copies/mL by Roche COBAS® Amplicor (limit of quantitation 300 copies/mL)
outcome.population: Treated participants who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

measure.title: Viral Load Undetectable (HBV DNA <300 Copies/mL)
measure.description: Number of Subjects with HBV DNA <300 copies/mL by Roche COBAS® Amplicor (limit of quantitation 300 copies/mL)
measure.population: Treated participants who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

outcome.title: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization
outcome.description: Number of participants with ALT ≤ 1 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
outcome.population: treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

measure.title: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization
measure.description: Number of participants with ALT ≤ 1 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
measure.population: treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. The model parameters of interest are the effectiveness of the drug in blocking virus production from infected cells (efficacy, ε) and effectiveness of the study treatment in blocking de novo infection of susceptible cells (η). The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.
outcome.population: Treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

class.title: Efficacy in blocking virus production - ε
Effectiveness in blocking de novo infections - η

outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. The model parameters of interest are the clearance rate of the free virus (c), the death rate of productively infected cells (δ), The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.

outcome.title: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics Estimates of Exponential Decay Model - Half-Life of Free Virus
outcome.description: The biphasic decline of HBV DNA is characterized via a 4-parameter exponential decay model previously published for HBV compounds. An important derived parameter is the half-life of free virus (ie, the average amount of time for HBV particles in plasma to be reduced to half the initial level), calculated as 24*ln(2)/c. The model parameters reflect the biphasic pattern that is typically observed after initiation of antiviral therapy. Parameters were estimated for each subject separately and then averaged within each treatment group.

outcome.title: HBV DNA Viral Kinetics - Spline Model
outcome.description: This analysis uses a 3-parameter piece-wise linear model and describes the biphasic decline in HBV DNA (measured by PCR assay) through Week 12. The 3 parameters are the values for the 2 slopes, describing the first and second phase declines, respectively, and the estimated HBV DNA at the knot (at day 10; the time point where the 2 phases join). The biphasic viral decay kinetics for each treatment were obtained using a spline fitting procedure to estimate the 3 parameters for each subject; these estimates were then averaged within each treatment group.
outcome.population: Treated subjects who had both baseline and Week 12 HBV DNA measurements and who received the randomized treatment. 1 participant randomized to ADV actually received ETV and is not counted in secondary efficacy analyses.

The 3 parameters are the values for the 2 slopes, describing the first and second phase declines, respectively, and the estimated HBV DNA at the knot (at day 10; the time point where the 2 phases join). The biphasic viral decay kinetics for each treatment were obtained using a spline fitting procedure to estimate the 3 parameters for each subject; these estimates were then averaged within each treatment group.

class.title: First slope (first phase of viral decay)
Second slope (second phase of viral decay)

outcome.title: Summary of Safety - Most Frequent (> 10%) Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Deaths
outcome.description: AE=new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship to treatment. SAE=untoward medical occurrence that is life-threatening, a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or an important medical event, or results in death, inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, or persistent/significant disability. AE grades: mild (1), moderate (2), severe (3), life-threatening (4), death (5). ALT flare= >2x baseline & >10x ULN up to end of therapy + 5 days. Hepatic SAE=SAEs consistent with worsening of hepatitis or hepatic decompensation.
outcome.time_frame: cumulative through the end of on-treatment observation as available at the time of the Week 48 dataset
outcome.population: As-treated population. 1 participant was randomized to ADV, but treated with ETV was counted in the ETV group.

measure.title: Summary of Safety - Most Frequent (> 10%) Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Deaths
measure.description: AE=new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship to treatment. SAE=untoward medical occurrence that is life-threatening, a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or an important medical event, or results in death, inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, or persistent/significant disability. AE grades: mild (1), moderate (2), severe (3), life-threatening (4), death (5). ALT flare= >2x baseline & >10x ULN up to end of therapy + 5 days. Hepatic SAE=SAEs consistent with worsening of hepatitis or hepatic decompensation.
measure.population: As-treated population. 1 participant was randomized to ADV, but treated with ETV was counted in the ETV group.

outcome.title: Summary of Safety - Laboratory Abnormalities Reported as Clinical AEs
outcome.description: Laboratory abnormalities reported as clinical AEs
outcome.population: As-treated population. 1 participant who was randomized to ADV, but treated with ETV was counted in the ETV group.

measure.title: Summary of Safety - Laboratory Abnormalities Reported as Clinical AEs
measure.description: Laboratory abnormalities reported as clinical AEs
measure.population: As-treated population. 1 participant who was randomized to ADV, but treated with ETV was counted in the ETV group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
